body: I need a backtrace, screenshot or something.  "Blank screen" tells me nothing.
Sorry if i wasn't to clear, the above is a blank screen

And here is the backtrace


That's not a backtrace, that's normal log output.  The backtrace would be in your app server's log, not sidekiq's log, since the Web UI runs in unicorn/puma.

Hi Mike, thanks for your quick reply

cap production "logs:tail[unicorn]"

Max

? is the happy hour open now?
Oh, yeah, you can totally jump into happy hour. https://appear.in/sidekiq

Ok, as I mentioned, the issue is that Sidekiq is trying to display the retry job's arguments by calling `inspect` on each argument.  One of the arguments is an ActiveRecord instance and calling inspect on it is raising an error.  Sidekiq needs to rescue and fallback to something safer.
You can run Sidekiq master using `gem 'sidekiq', github: 'mperham/sidekiq'` in your Gemfile or you can wait for 3.4.2 (probably not for a few weeks).

I found the error in one of my mailers

Opbeat.capture_message( #{user.email} : #{user.user_name}" )

Opbeat is a great help but in this case user is nil. 
so the combination looks like it stalls sidekiq

I will spend a little more time looking in to it

Max

> On 26/06/2015, at 19.07, Mike Perham notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> You can run Sidekiq master using gem 'sidekiq', github: 'mperham/sidekiq' in your Gemfile or you can wait for 3.4.2 (probably not for a few weeks).
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/issues/2405#issuecomment-115767361.

issue.title: Forbidden when clicking on retry

repository.name: sidekiq
repository.description: Simple, efficient background processing for Ruby

issue.body:
# The use case

My sidekiq web interface, and sidekiq process, are 2 different rails projects (both connecting to the same redis instance obviously).  

When in `production mode` a weird behavior happens.
If one of the jobs fails, and I want to manually retry it, using any of these buttons ![screen shot 2015-08-13 at 11 14 18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11553456/9246556/b0e60f2a-41ac-11e5-9fa8-1235d650ae36.png) ![screen shot 2015-08-13 at 11 14 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11553456/9246558/b0e662d6-41ac-11e5-8c34-55b8f61eea08.png), I am redirect on a white page with only `Forbidden` on it, and my devise session is destroyed.
This does not happen in `development mode`.

```
URL when clicking retry: http://localhost:3000/sidekiq/retries/1439457271.0547059-2294ccdf2a6c8594801f1dfc
page content: Forbidden
```
## Environment

``` ruby
Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS
ruby 2.2.1p85
rails (4.2.3)
sidekiq (3.4.2)
  celluloid (~> 0.16.0)
  connection_pool (~> 2.2, >= 2.2.0)
  json (~> 1.0)
  redis (~> 3.2, >= 3.2.1)
  redis-namespace (~> 1.5, >= 1.5.2)
devise (3.5.2)
   bcrypt (~> 3.0)
   orm_adapter (~> 0.1)
   railties (>= 3.2.6, < 5)
   responders
   thread_safe (~> 0.1)
   warden (~> 1.2.3)
```
## Initializer

``` ruby
template = ERB.new File.new(File.join(Rails.root, 'config', 'sidekiq.yml')).read
raw_yaml = YAML.load template.result(binding)
SIDEKIQ_CONFIG = raw_yaml.merge(raw_yaml[Rails.env])

Sidekiq.default_worker_options = { 'backtrace' => true }

Sidekiq.configure_client do |config|
  config.client_middleware do |chain|
    chain.add Sidekiq::Status::ClientMiddleware
  end
  config.redis = {
      :url       => SIDEKIQ_CONFIG[:url],
      :namespace => SIDEKIQ_CONFIG[:namespace],
      :size      => SIDEKIQ_CONFIG[:client_connections]
  }
end

require 'sidekiq/web'
require 'sidetiq/web'
require 'sidekiq-status/web'
```
## sidekiq.yml

``` yaml
default: &default
  :verbose: true
  :pidfile: tmp/pids/sidekiq.pid
  :url: redis://localhost:6379/0
  :client_connections: 10
  :concurrency: 10
  :timeout: 5
  :queues:
    - default

<<: *default


development:
  <<: *default
  :pidfile: tmp/pids/sidekiq_dev.pid
  :namespace: dev

production:
  <<: *default
  :pidfile: tmp/pids/sidekiq_prod.pid
  :logfile: ./log/sidekiq_prod.log
  :namespace: prod
  :verbose: false
  :url: <%= "redis://#{ENV['REDIS_IP'] || '127.0.0.1'}:6379/0" %>
  :concurrency: 17
  :client_connections: 17
```
## Routes

``` ruby
  authenticate :user do
    mount Sidekiq::Web => '/sidekiq'
  end
```
